title: La Vuelta a España 2021 Standings after Stage 6
content:
General Classification / Red Jersey 

After crosswinds and a steep uphill finish, we saw a shake up in the General Classification today at La Vuelta and a change in the holder of the red jersey. Primož Roglič is the new leader of the race as Kenny Elissonde slipped back on the final climb. It was a good day for Movistar who now hold 2nd, 3rd and 4th positions on GC after a dominating display of teamwork coming in to the final climb.

1. Primož Roglič
2. Enric Mas +0:25
3. Miguel Ángel López +0:36
4. Alejandro Valverde +0:41
5. Egan Bernal +0:41
6. Aleksandr Vlasov +0:53
7. Giulio Ciccone +0:58
8. Lilian Calmejane +1:04
9. Mikel Landa +1:12
10. Fabio Aru +1:17

La Vuelta a Espana 2021: Route, Predictions and Contenders

Points Classification

1. Jasper Philipsen - 131 points
2. Fabio Jakobsen - 130 points
3. Magnus Cort - 67 points
4. Michael Matthews - 58 points
5. Primož Roglič - 54 points

La Vuelta Stage 7 Preview

King of the Mountains Classification

1. Rein Taaramäe - 10 points
2. Kenny Elissonde - 7 points
3. Joe Dombrowski - 6 points
4. Tobias Bayer - 5 points
5. Sepp Kuss - 3 points

Young Rider's Classification

1. Egan Bernal
2. Aleksandr Vlasov + 0:12
3. Juan Pedro Lopez +1:24
4. Gino Mader +1:32
5. Tobias Bayer +1:57

Team Classification

1. Movistar Team
2. Ineos Grenadiers +1:32
3. UAE Team Emirates +1:39
4. Bahrain - Victorious +2:07
5. AG2R Citroen +3:57

author: Peter Stuart
